modName: All Enchant Recipes - Via Disenchant (VANILLA ONLY)
summary: Simple bat file to give you a series of items, each with one of the available enchantments on them. These you can disenchant, to gain access to all the recipes for when you wish to enchant your own items. (VANILLA ENCHANTS ONLY)
descriptionHtml:
== VANILLA ONLY ==

This bat only contains the enchantments for the vanilla version of Skyrim. If for some reason you don't have the DLC or don't want those enchants then feel free to use this mod. If you want all the DLC enchants, you can find them in mods other people have made.

Simple bat file to give you a series of items, each with one of the available enchantments on them. These you can disenchant, to gain access to all/most of the recipes for when you wish to enchant your own items.

Copy the text file named "allchant" to:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\skyrim

or

C:\Program Files\Steam\SteamApps\common\skyrim

[u][b]Notes:[/b][/u]

. This will level your enchant skill.
. [s]I know Fortify Barter isn't included. I couldn't find an item with it on.[/s] Added.
. [s]It appears "Muffle" doesn't want to work. If anyone knows an item they've taken this enchantment from successfully, let me know.[/s] Fixed.
. I suggest being next to an enchant table before doing this. You will likely be encumbered after receiving the items.

[u][b]Instructions[/b][/u]

1) Start Skyrim.

2) I suggest dropping your main (magical) weapons/armour/rings before doing this, if they're enchanted, to avoid accidentally disenchanting them.

3) When in game, load your save and open the console using the console key. ("~" or "`" - It's the key to the left of the "1" on your keyboard and above "tab".)

4) Type in the console: bat allchant

5) Save and exit to the desktop. Restart Skyrim and load your save. This is incase Skyrim disables achievements after you've used the console. I'm not 100% sure on this, but I'll put it here just incase. I know this method will allow you to continue getting achievements, just like it worked with New Vegas.

6) This should give you a whole host of items. Disenchant them all.

7) Enjoy! If you happen to find an enchantment you want isn't there. Please let me know and I'll do my best to track down an item with it to add to the list.

Please endorse if you find this useful. It makes it easier for others to find!







[u]Credits:[/u]

Seferon - Thanks for filling in the last few blanks and tidying up the syntax!
author: Akimb0
